content.description:
Brushy and guano filled cracks lead to an excellent right leaning double hand crack. A mantle pulls off the steep face and onto a large ledge. Around a corner a short and easy wide crack leads to another ledge at the top of the routes Dharma and Karma.

To avoid lots of rope drag at the end of the pitch, it is best to run out the wide crack to the second ledge. Also if top roping, the anchor on top of Dharma is better than the recommended anchor on top of Karma.
content.protection: A standard rock rack with gear to 3.5".
content.location: This route is far left on this upper terrace and starts just right of a 4 foot block.

content.description:
Climb up the face using a slightly left slanting thin seem.   The climbing up the seem is delicate in parts.

A ledge is reached at the top of the seem where you can rest before swinging right to climb the arete to the top.
content.location: Located just left of the central tower.

content.description:
Climbs the steep face.

While not technical in nature, the climbing is steep and sustained for the first half of the route.
content.location: Located to the right of the water chute, which is right of the central tower

content.description: Starting at an arete, climb the face passed 3 distinct overhangs.   The climbing is steep, but never too sustained.
content.location: Located on the face right of the central tower

content.description:
Climb up the slabby arete of the central tower.

Easy angled climbing with no real difficulties.
content.location: Climbs the slabby arete on central tower

content.description: Seam to a left facing flake.  Very good climbing.
content.location: Fourth route left of Sound of One Hand Slapping

content.description: Technical face on edges and pockets to a seam.
Use face holds and finger locks to get you to the hand crack.  At the 4th bolt traverse out of the crack up and right past two more bolts to the anchor.
content.location:
On the leftmost side of the crag, a 50 ft. sand slog uphill from

Kill the Buddha

.

content.description: Starts in a corner, then move onto a face, then back into a steep corner system.
content.location: In between Chronic and Chase the Dragon, second bolt line from the far right. Lower off.

content.description: The book calls this a 5.8 face climb. The face is harder than 5.8 and there is a nice finger crack in corner to the right. So, slab start, up crack in corner,a few face moves to anchors? Was wondering if I was on the right route.
content.location: Located at the "toe" of the buttress. Last route on left before steep pumice slope, by itself.

content.description: Thin climbing up a finger crack leads to a sloping right leaning ledge. Nest some gear here before climbing out on the face to the left and over to the upper section of Dharma. After a move or two in that crack, move back and right to a glory hand crack to the top.
content.protection: A standard rock rack from small to 2.5"
content.location: Karma follows the right most of the cracks before the bolted lines start.

content.description: Face climbing to a left facing scoop, then up a steep lieback flake.
content.protection: 5 bolts to open hooks.  A bit sporty.
content.location: Right of Sangha and the third route left of Sound of One Hand Slapping

content.description:
Make hard starting moves up a face.   At a bush, by the second bolt, step right and climb up through a steep bulge.   Once established on the slab above the bulge climb up trending right towards the anchors.

As the slab steepens another hard section is reached.   Pass this and finish easily on very positive holds.
content.location: Middle of the wall to the right of the water chute.

content.description: Climb up to and through a steep corner and then move right and finish up the face to an anchor.
Start in a bushy depression and move into an awkward pod. Thin climbing up a finger crack leads to the top.
content.location: Dharma follows the middle crack of trad climbs on the left side of the blocky terrace.

content.description:
Climb a shallow dihedral, and head left towards the obvious steep arete.

Climb the right side of the arete on good holds until a tricky sequence just below the anchors.
This route offers diverse moves including slab, a lieback, a mantel and a thin upper face. The mantel is fun and exposed! Use a longer draw on the bolt before the mantel to reduce rope drag.
content.location: This is the farthest right route on the cliff.

content.description:
Climb up the wall to the left of the obvious corner, until possible to stem the corner and hand jam the crack.  The corner is the crux.

After the corner fun climbing on jugs follows all the way to the anchors.
content.location: Situated just right of the arete of Sound of One Hand Slapping.

content.description: Climb the face trending right into a corner.  Climb this with difficulty and finish up the arete.
